intro: Trichospermum tripyxis, commonly known as the three-lobed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic, containing cardiac glycosides. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Trichospermum tripyxis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
